messages.content: You need to judge whether there is Stiction by the image. The image has PV (blue line) and OP (orange line) on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. PV stands for process variable and OP stands for controller output. Typical feature of Stiction: 1. When OP changes, PV does not respond immediately but remains at its original level, once OP exceeds a certain threshold, PV suddenly jumps. 2. The change of PV lags behind that of OP. Stiction can only be judged if both characteristics are met.
<image>This is PV&OP-t graph. Is there stiction?
Yes, there is stiction in this control loop.
Why, how do you judge?
The change of PV lags behind that of OP, and there is an obvious stick-jump phenomenon.
